tool.name: AddFeatCol2MapbyID
tool.displayname: Add Feature Collection to Map by Asset ID

param.name: asset_id
param.displayname: Specify the feature collection asset ID
param.dialogReference: The asset ID could be found at the dataset information page. For example, ee.FeatureCollection('BLM/AIM/v1/TerrADat/TerrestrialAIM') loads the Google Earth Engine Image Collection by asset ID BLM/AIM/v1/TerrADat/TerrestrialAIM.

param.name: filter_props
param.dialogReference: Filter the feature collection by values of its properties. The user needs to select a property, an operation and a value to filter the feature collection. For example, "ADM2_NAME == 'Denver'" has the property name as 'ADM2_NAME', operator '==', and filter value 'Denver'. The user can apply as many filters as needed.

param.name: filter_dates
param.dialogReference:
The user can filter the image collection by starting and ending dates. The typical formats of date strings are listed below.

  1. Year only, '2020'

  2. Year and month, '2020-07'

  3. Year, month and date, '2020-07-01'

  4. Year, month, date, and time, '2020-07-05T06:34:46'

For more information, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/apidocs/ee-imagecollection-filterdate

param.name: filter_bounds
param.dialogReference: Filter a feature collection by intersection with polygon geometry. Items in the feature collection with a footprint that fails to intersect the given geometry will be excluded.

param.name: use_poly
param.displayname: Choose a polygon as region of interest
param.dialogReference: Use the user-defined polygon as the geometry. If the polygon contains multiple parts, the full extent of the polygon will be utilized.

param.name: color
param.dialogReference: You can specify the color the feature collection for visualization. For example, red, yellow, green, blue, etc. or CSS-style hex strings.

param.name: out_json
param.displayname: Save the filtered feature collection to serialized JSON file
param.dialogReference: Save the filtered image collection to a serialized JSON object for future use.

tool.summary:
This script adds the Google Earth Engine Feature Collection to ArcGIS Pro as a base map by its asset tag and customizes the visualization parameters. To avoid slow response, the feature collection size is limited to 100,000 elements.

Please note that the dataset is added as a Tiled Map Service Layer, which is view only and cannot be edited. The user will need to download the dataset for analysis in ArcGIS Pro. To browse all datasets, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/datasets/catalog.

idCitation.resTitle: Add Feature Collection to Map by Asset ID
